EN

JP Morgan has announced its preference for Bitcoin over gold for long-term investment, despite recent Bitcoin price drops. The banking giant's quantitative strategist, Nikolaos Panigirtzoglou, explained that gold's recent outperformance and rising volatility have made Bitcoin appear more attractive. Bitcoin's volatility relative to gold has reached a record low, suggesting significant long-term upside potential. The cryptocurrency market has shown resilience with modest outflows despite recent fluctuations, and analysts view Bitcoin as becoming a 'mathematical peer' to gold rather than just a speculative asset.

Key Points

  • JP Morgan favors Bitcoin over gold for long-term investment despite recent price drops
  • Bitcoin's volatility relative to gold has reached a record low, indicating long-term upside potential
  • Analysts predict Bitcoin could reach $170K based on portfolio parity with gold, with forecasts of $82,384 by 2026 and $166,372 by 2030

Article

JP Morgan, a leading banking giant, has selected Bitcoin as the ultimate savior for the long run, rejecting gold‚Äôs soaring price performance as of late. The banking lead has shared how it believes Bitcoin will perform better in the future rather than gold, stating how BTC packs a bunch of benefits for institutions to bask in for the long run.
